00018 /*
00019  * ==============================================================================
00020  *
00021  *                  FCVBP Interface Package
00022  *
00023  * The FCVBP Interface Package is a package of C functions which,
00024  * together with the FCVODE Interface Package, support the use of the
00025  * CVODE solver (serial version) with the CVBANDPRE preconditioner module,
00026  * for the solution of ODE systems in a mixed Fortran/C setting.  The
00027  * combination of CVODE and CVBANDPRE solves systems dy/dt = f(t,y) with the
00028  * SPGMR (scaled preconditioned GMRES), SPTFQMR (scaled preconditioned TFQMR),
00029  *  or SPBCG (scaled preconditioned Bi-CGSTAB) method for the linear systems
00030  * that arise, and with a banded difference quotient Jacobian-based preconditioner.
00031  * 
00032  * The user-callable functions in this package, with the corresponding
00033  * CVODE and CVBBDPRE functions, are as follows: 
00034  *   FCVBPINIT    interfaces to CVBandPrecAlloc
00035  *   FCVBPSPTFQMR interfaces to CVBPSptfqmr
00036  *   FCVBPSPBCG   interfaces to CVBPSpbcg
00037  *   FCVBPSPGMR   interfaces to CVBPSpgmr
00038  *   FCVBPOPT     accesses optional outputs
00039  *   FCVBPFREE    interfaces to CVBandPrecFree
00040  * 
00041  * In addition to the Fortran right-hand side function FCVFUN, the
00042  * user may (optionally) supply a routine FCVJTIMES which is called by 
00043  * the interface function FCVJtimes of type CVSpilsJtimesFn.
00044  * (The names of all user-supplied routines here are fixed, in order to
00045  * maximize portability for the resulting mixed-language program.)
00046  * 
00047  * Important note on portability.
00048  * In this package, the names of the interface functions, and the names of
00049  * the Fortran user routines called by them, appear as dummy names
00050  * which are mapped to actual values by a series of definitions in the
00051  * header file fcvbp.h.
00052  * 
00053  * ==============================================================================
00054  * 
00055  *               Usage of the FCVODE/FCVBP Interface Packages
00056  * 
00057  * The usage of the combined interface packages FCVODE and FCVBP requires
00058  * calls to seven to ten interface functions, and one or two user-supplied
00059  * routines which define the problem to be solved and indirectly define
00060  * the preconditioner.  These function calls and user routines are
00061  * summarized separately below.
00062  * 
00063  * Some details are omitted, and the user is referred to the CVODE user document 
00064  * for more complete information.
00065  * 
00066  * (1) User-supplied right-hand side routine: FCVFUN
00067  * The user must in all cases supply the following Fortran routine
00068  *       SUBROUTINE FCVFUN (T, Y, YDOT, IPAR, RPAR, IER)
00069  *       DIMENSION Y(*), YDOT(*), IPAR(*), RPAR(*)
00070  * It must set the YDOT array to f(t,y), the right-hand side of the ODE
00071  * system, as function of T = t and the array Y = y.  Here Y and YDOT
00072  * are distributed vectors.
00073  * 
00074  * (2) Optional user-supplied Jacobian-vector product routine: FCVJTIMES
00075  * As an option, the user may supply a routine that computes the product
00076  * of the system Jacobian J = df/dy and a given vector v.  If supplied, it
00077  * must have the following form:
00078  *       SUBROUTINE FCVJTIMES (V, FJV, T, Y, FY, EWT, IPAR, RPAR, WORK, IER)
00079  *       DIMENSION V(*), FJV(*), Y(*), FY(*), EWT(*), IPAR(*), RPAR(*), WORK(*)
00080  * Typically this routine will use only NEQ, T, Y, V, and FJV.  It must
00081  * compute the product vector Jv, where the vector v is stored in V, and store
00082  * the product in FJV.  On return, set IER = 0 if FCVJTIMES was successful,
00083  * and nonzero otherwise.
00084  * 
00085  * (3) Initialization:  FNVINITS, FCVMALLOC, FCVBPINIT.
00086  * 
00087  * (3.1) To initialize the serial vector specification, the user must make 
00088  * the following call:
00089  *        CALL FNVINITS(NEQ, IER)
00090  * where NEQ is the problem size and IER is a return completion flag.
00091  * Possible values for IER are 0 = success, -1 = failure.
00092  * 
00093  * (3.2) To set various problem and solution parameters and allocate
00094  * internal memory for CVODE, make the following call:
00095  *       CALL FCVMALLOC(T0, Y0, METH, ITMETH, IATOL, RTOL, ATOL,
00096  *      1               IOUT, ROUT, IPAR, RPAR, IER)
00097  * The arguments are:
00098  * T0     = initial value of t
00099  * Y0     = array of initial conditions
00100  * METH   = basic integration method: 1 = Adams (nonstiff), 2 = BDF (stiff)
00101  * ITMETH = nonlinear iteration method: 1 = functional iteration, 2 = Newton iter.
00102  * IATOL  = type for absolute tolerance ATOL: 1 = scalar, 2 = array
00103  * RTOL   = relative tolerance (scalar)
00104  * ATOL   = absolute tolerance (scalar or array)
00105  * IOUT   = array of length 21 for integer optional outputs
00106  *          (declare as INTEGER*4 or INTEGER*8 according to C type long int)
00107  * ROUT   = array of length 6 for real optional outputs
00108  * IPAR   = array with user integer data
00109  *          (declare as INTEGER*4 or INTEGER*8 according to C type long int)
00110  * RPAR   = array with user real data
00111  * IER    = return completion flag.  Values are 0 = success, and -1 = failure.
00112  *          See printed message for details in case of failure.
00113  * 
00114  * (3.3) To allocate memory and initialize data associated with the CVBANDPRE
00115  * preconditioner, make the following call:
00116  *       CALL FCVBPINIT(NEQ, MU, ML, IER)
00117  * The arguments are:
00118  * NEQ       = problem size
00119  * MU, ML    = upper and lower half-bandwidths of the band matrix that 
00120  *             is retained as an approximation of the Jacobian.
00121  * IER       = return completion flag: IER=0: success, IER<0: and error occurred
00122  *
00123  * (3.4A) To specify the SPGMR linear solver with the CVBANDPRE preconditioner,
00124  * make the following call
00125  *       CALL FCVBPSPGMR(IPRETYPE, IGSTYPE, MAXL, DELT, IER)
00126  * The arguments are:
00127  * IPRETYPE  = preconditioner type: 
00128  *            0 = none
00129  *            1 = left only
00130  *            2 = right only
00131  *            3 = both sides.
00132  * IGSTYPE   = Gram-schmidt process type: 0 = modified G-S, 1 = classical G-S.
00133  * MAXL      = maximum Krylov subspace dimension; 0 indicates default.
00134  * DELT      = linear convergence tolerance factor; 0.0 indicates default.
00135  * IER       = return completion flag: IER=0: success, IER<0: ans error occurred
00136  *
00137  * (3.4B) To specify the SPBCG linear solver with the CVBANDPRE preconditioner,
00138  * make the following call
00139  *       CALL FCVBPSPBCG(IPRETYPE, MAXL, DELT, IER)
00140  * The arguments are:
00141  * IPRETYPE  = preconditioner type: 
00142  *            0 = none
00143  *            1 = left only
00144  *            2 = right only
00145  *            3 = both sides.
00146  * MAXL      = maximum Krylov subspace dimension; 0 indicates default.
00147  * DELT      = linear convergence tolerance factor; 0.0 indicates default.
00148  * IER       = return completion flag: IER=0: success, IER<0: ans error occurred
00149  *
00150  * (3.4C) To specify the SPTFQMR linear solver with the CVBANDPRE preconditioner,
00151  * make the following call
00152  *       CALL FCVBPSPTFQMR(IPRETYPE, MAXL, DELT, IER)
00153  * The arguments are:
00154  * IPRETYPE  = preconditioner type: 
00155  *            0 = none
00156  *            1 = left only
00157  *            2 = right only
00158  *            3 = both sides.
00159  * MAXL      = maximum Krylov subspace dimension; 0 indicates default.
00160  * DELT      = linear convergence tolerance factor; 0.0 indicates default.
00161  * IER       = return completion flag: IER=0: success, IER<0: ans error occurred
00162  *
00163  * (3.5) To specify whether the Krylov linear solver (GMRES, Bi-CGSTAB, or TFQMR) 
00164  * should use the supplied FCVJTIMES or the internal finite difference approximation, 
00165  * make the call
00166  *        CALL FCVSPILSSETJAC(FLAG, IER)
00167  * where FLAG=0 for finite differences approxaimtion or
00168  *       FLAG=1 to use the supplied routine FCVJTIMES
00169  *
00170  * (4) The integrator: FCVODE
00171  * Carrying out the integration is accomplished by making calls as follows:
00172  *       CALL FCVODE (TOUT, T, Y, ITASK, IER)
00173  * The arguments are:
00174  * TOUT  = next value of t at which a solution is desired (input)
00175  * T     = value of t reached by the solver on output
00176  * Y     = array containing the computed solution on output
00177  * ITASK = task indicator: 1 = normal mode (overshoot TOUT and interpolate);
00178  *         2 = one-step mode (return after each internal step taken);
00179  *         3 = normal mode with TSTOP; 4 = one-step mode with TSTOP.
00180  * IER   = completion flag: 0 = success, 1 = TSTOP return, 2 = root return,
00181  *         negative values are various failure modes (see CVODE User Guide).
00182  * The current values of the optional outputs are available in IOUT and ROUT.
00183  * 
00184  * (5) Optional outputs: FCVBPOPT
00185  * Optional outputs specific to the SP* solver are LRW, LIW, LFLG, NFELS, NJTV,
00186  * NPE, NPS, NLI, NCFL, stored in IOUT(13)...IOUT(21).
00187  * To obtain the optional outputs associated with the CVBANDPRE module, make
00188  * the following call:
00189  *       CALL FCVBPOPT(LENRWBP, LENIWBP, NFEBP)
00190  * The arguments returned are:
00191  * LENRWBP = length of real preconditioner work space, in realtype words.
00192  *           This size is local to the current processor.
00193  * LENIWBP = length of integer preconditioner work space, in integer words.
00194  *           This size is local to the current processor.
00195  * NFEBP   = number of f(t,y) evaluations for CVBANDPRE
00196  * 
00197  * (6) Computing solution derivatives: FCVDKY
00198  * To obtain a derivative of the solution (optionally), of order up to
00199  * the current method order, make the following call:
00200  *       CALL FCVDKY (T, K, DKY)
00201  * The arguments are:
00202  * T   = value of t at which solution derivative is desired
00203  * K   = derivative order (0 .le. K .le. QU)
00204  * DKY = array containing computed K-th derivative of y on return
00205  * 
00206  * (7) Memory freeing: FCVBPFREE and FCVFREE
00207  *   To the free the internal memory created by the calls to FNVINITS,
00208  * FCVMALLOC, and FCVBPINIT, make the following calls, in this order:
00209  *       CALL FCVBPFREE
00210  *       CALL FCVFREE
00211  * 
00212  * ==============================================================================
00213  */
00214
